snippet: A new movie about a South Korean man’s fight against the country’s judiciary system has revived complaints about the courts.
abstract: South Korean movie Unbowed, which documents former mathematics Prof Kim Myung-ho's dispute with country's judicial system, resonates with many South Koreans; Kim, who was sentenced to four years in prison for assaulting a judge with a crossbow, likens the country's judges to gangsters.
lead_paragraph: A new movie about a South Korean man’s fight against the country’s judiciary system has revived complaints about the courts.

headline.seo: Crossbow Becomes a Symbol of South Korean Judicial Problems
headline.main: Out of Jail, Ex-Professor and His Crossbow Fight South Korea’s Judiciary
headline.print_headline: Out of Jail, Ex-Professor And His Crossbow Fight South Korea’s Judiciary
